bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Laura Wood, June 29, 1942

div1.p: Hench tells Wood that he will send Heilbron part of Wood's manuscript. He also discusses his upcoming military duty.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Laura Wood, June 29, 1942
div1.opener:
June 29, 1942
Miss Laura Wood
230 South 19th Street
Philadelphia, Pa.
My dear Miss Wood:
div1.p:
I am sure that Miss Heilbron will appreciate greatly your
letter. I wish I knew more to help her out but I don't. Be sure to
keep me informed regarding your book. I am sending Miss Heilbron the
Minnesota part of your manuscript.

I expect to go into service in about three weeks, for
preliminary training somewhere, perhaps Fort Custer, Michigan, and
after that, as chief of the medical service at Camp Carson, Colorado
Springs, supposedly with the rank of Lieutenant Colonel. All of these
presumptions and suppositions reflect the fact that 98 percent of
my information has been given me by telephonic communication and
practically nothing by letter. I still have no formal orders or papers.
I was given the privilege of selecting the medical staff and hope to
have a nice group of men with me.

Should you wish to write me about anything please do so
at this address which will of course forward all my mail.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
